result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua L Christopherson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: any probation presently on.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. Any bond money will be applied to court costs.   
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed physician and in the amount as prescribed. 
Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Court not prohibiting defendant from entering any establishments, but probation agent may order.

Must follow through with any follow-up treatment recommended for alcohol or mental treatment.
Must continue to take psychotropic medications as prescribed. 
Must successfully complete Barron County Drug Court Program. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Joshua L Christopherson in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-sentence investigation discussed.  No errors or omissions.
Joint recommendation:
Impose and stay 5 years prison with 2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision. 
Probation 3 years - concurrent with 12CF435.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Must successfully complete Barron County Drug Court program.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court costs
DNA surcharge.
Credit for 26 days jail, if revoked.

Argument by Attorney Berg.  Argument by Attorney Hinde.

Court relates and orders:
Impose and stay 5 years 0  months prison with 2 years 6 months initial confinement and 2 years 6 months extended supervision.  Dodge Reception Center.  Eligibile for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Probation 3 years - concurrent to any probation presently on.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed physician and in the amount as prescribed.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  Court not prohibiting defendant from entering any establishments, but probation agent may order.
Follow through with any follow-up treatment recommended for alcohol or mental treatment.
Must continue to take psychotropic meds as prescribed.  
Must successfully complete Barron County Drug Court program.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court costs due within 60 days or payment plan.
DNA sample and surcharge due within 60 days or payment plan.
Credit for 26 days jail, if revoked.

Any bond money will be applied to court costs.  

WEDS given to defendant. 
Voter's rights given to defendant.

Defendant Joshua L Christopherson in court with attorney John G Hinde.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State and defense waive PSI; however, Court orders PSI
